books.title: Fourth Wing
books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.desc: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

books.title: Iron Flame
books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.desc: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training might require her to betray the man she loves.

books.title: The Heaven & Earth Grocery Store
books.author: James McBride
books.desc: Secrets held by the residents of a dilapidated neighborhood come to life when a skeleton is found at the bottom of a well.

books.title: Lessons in Chemistry
books.author: Bonnie Garmus
books.desc: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.

books.title: The Exchange
books.author: John Grisham
books.desc: In a sequel to “The Firm,” Mitch McDeere, who is now a partner at the world’s largest law firm, gets caught up in a sinister plot.

books.title: The Little Liar
books.author: Mitch Albom
books.desc: The actions of an 11-year-old boy help facilitate the delivery of Jewish residents, including his family, to Auschwitz.

books.title: The Serpent and the Wings of Night
books.author: Carissa Broadbent
books.desc: The first book in the “Crowns of Nyaxia” series. Oraya enters a tournament held by the goddess of death.

books.title: Holly
books.author: Stephen King
books.desc: The private detective Holly Gibney investigates whether a married pair of octogenarian academics had anything to do with Bonnie Dahl’s disappearance.

books.title: Demon Copperhead
books.author: Barbara Kingsolver
books.desc: Winner of a 2023 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. A reimagining of Charles Dickens’s “David Copperfield” set in the mountains of southern Appalachia.

books.title: Tom Lake
books.author: Ann Patchett
books.desc: Three daughters, who return to their family orchard in the spring of 2020, learn about their mother’s relationship with a famous actor.

books.title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
books.author: Gabrielle Zevin
books.desc: Two friends find their partnership challenged in the world of video game design.

books.title: The Covenant of Water
books.author: Abraham Verghese
books.desc: Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning.

books.title: Remarkably Bright Creatures
books.author: Shel Van Pelt
books.desc: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.

books.title: Alex Cross Must Die
books.author: James Patterson
books.desc: The 32nd book in the Alex Cross series. When a jet is gunned down, Cross goes back into action.

books.title: The Edge
books.author: David Baldacci
books.desc: The second book in the 6:20 Man series. Travis Devine investigates the murder of the C.I.A. operative Jenny Silkwell in rural Maine.

books.title: The Wager
books.author: David Grann
books.desc: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.

books.title: Oath and Honor
books.author: Liz Cheney
books.desc: The former congresswoman from Wyoming recounts how she helped lead the Select Committee to Investigate the Jan. 6. Attack on the United States Capitol.

books.title: The Woman in Me
books.author: Britney Spears
books.desc: The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father.

books.title: Friends, Lovers, and the Big Terrible Thing
books.author: Matthew Perry
books.desc: The late actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety.

books.title: Outlive
books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.desc: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

books.title: Prequel
books.author: Rachel Maddow
books.desc: The MSNBC host and co-author of “Bag Man” details a campaign to overthrow the U.S. government and install authoritarian rule prior to and during our involvement in World War II.

books.title: Elon Musk
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.desc: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence.

books.title: I'm Glad My Mom Died
books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.desc: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.

books.title: My Name Is Barbra
books.author: Barbra Streisand
books.desc: The EGOT winner chronicles her journey in show business and reveals details about some of her personal relationships.

books.title: The Kingdom, the Power, and the Glory
books.author: Tim Alberta
books.desc: The author of “American Carnage” looks at divisions within the American evangelical movement.

books.title: Ghosts of Honolulu
books.author: Mark Harmon and Leon Carroll Jr
books.desc: The story of a Japanese American naval intelligence agent, a Japanese spy and events in Hawaii before the start of World War II.

books.title: Behind the Seams
books.author: Dolly Parton with Holly George-Warren
books.desc: The country music legend shares stories about her favorite outfits she has worn on and off the stage.

books.title: My Effin' Life
books.author: Geddy Lee with Daniel Richler
books.desc: The musician known for his work with the band Rush chronicles his life as the child of Holocaust survivors and his time in the limelight.

books.title: Being Henry
books.author: Henry Winkler with James Kaplan
books.desc: The Emmy Award-winning actor shares how playing roles such as the Fonz and his struggles with dyslexia affected his life.

books.title: Killing the Witches
books.author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.desc: The 13th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series gives a portrayal of the events of 1692 and 1693 in Salem Village, Mass.

books.title: Icebreaker
books.author: Hannah Grace
books.desc: Anastasia might need the help of the captain of a college hockey team to get on the Olympic figure skating team.

books.title: Twisted Love
books.author: Ana Huang
books.desc: The first book in the Twisted series. Secrets emerge when Ava explores things with her brother’s best friend.

books.title: Wildfire
books.author: Hannah Grace
books.desc: The second book in the Maple Hills series. Two summer camp counselors who previously had a one-night stand may run afoul of the camp’s rules.

books.title: The Housemaid
books.author: Freida McFadden
books.desc: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

books.title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.desc: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

books.title: The Silent Patient
books.author: Alex Michaelides
books.desc: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

books.title: It Ends with Us
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.desc: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

books.title: A Little Life
books.author: Hanya Yanagihara
books.desc: Four college friends, one with a traumatic past, move to New York seeking fame and fortune.

books.title: House of Earth and Blood
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.desc: Passion arises between Bryce Quinlan and Hunt Athalar as they seek to avenge the deaths of Bryce’s friends.

books.title: King of Wrath
books.author: Ana Huang
books.desc: A billionaire chief executive is blackmailed into marrying a jewelry heiress who is the daughter of his latest enemy.

books.title: House of Sky and Breath
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.desc: The second book in the Crescent City series. Bryce Quinlan and Hunt Athalar must choose to fight or stay silent.

books.title: Twisted Games
books.author: Ana Huang
books.desc: The second book in the Twisted series. A princess and an elite bodyguard find themselves experiencing a forbidden love.

books.title: All the Light We Cannot See
books.author: Anthony Doerr
books.desc: The lives of a blind French girl and a gadget-obsessed German boy before and during World War II.

books.title: Verity
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.desc: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.

books.title: A Court of Silver Flames
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.desc: The fifth book in the Court of Thorns and Roses series. Nesta Archeron is forced into close quarters with a warrior named Cassian.

books.title: The Boys in the Boat
books.author: Daniel James Brown
books.desc: The story of the American rowers who pursued gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympic Games; the basis of the film.

books.title: Killers of the Flower Moon
books.author: David Grann
books.desc: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.

books.title: The Body Keeps the Score
books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.desc: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

books.title: Everything I Know About Love
books.author: Dolly Alderton
books.desc: The British journalist shares stories and observations; the basis of the TV series.

books.title: The Storyteller
books.author: Dave Grohl
books.desc: A memoir by the musician known for his work with Foo Fighters and Nirvana.

books.title: The Hundred Years' War on Palestine
books.author: Rashid Khalidi
books.desc: An account of the history of settler colonialism and resistance, based on untapped archival materials and reports.

books.title: American Prometheus
books.author: Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin
books.desc: A biography of J. Robert Oppenheimer. Winner of the Pulitzer Prize in 2006 and an inspiration for the film “Oppenheimer.”

books.title: All About Love
books.author: bell hooks
books.desc: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.

books.title: Braiding Sweetgrass
books.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.desc: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

books.title: Sapiens
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.desc: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.

books.title: Crying in H Mart
books.author: Michelle Zauner
books.desc: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

books.title: Think Again
books.author: Adam Grant
books.desc: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

books.title: The Lyrics: 1956 to the Present
books.author: Paul McCartney
books.desc: A celebration of 161 songs, with handwritten texts, paintings and photographs from the songwriter’s archives.

books.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.desc: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.

books.title: Talking to Strangers
books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.desc: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.

books.title: Bad Luck and Trouble
books.author: Lee Child
books.desc: The 11th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher must discover who is hunting members of a team of former military investigators.

books.title: Without a Trace
books.author: Danielle Steel
books.desc: Charles Vincent meets someone who ignites his passion and must decide whether to walk away from his perfect-from-the-outside life.

books.title: 3 Days to Live
books.author: James Patterson
books.desc: Three thrillers: “3 Days to Live,” “Women and Children First” and “The Housekeepers.”

books.title: Gabriel's Angel
books.author: Nora Roberts
books.desc: On a snowy night in Colorado, a man saves a stranded pregnant woman and joins her custody battle after falling in love.

books.title: Tom Clancy: Red Winter
books.author: Marc Cameron
books.desc: The 22nd book in the Jack Ryan series. Ryan goes behind the Berlin Wall in 1985 to investigate an East German defector.

books.title: The Jailhouse Lawyer
books.author: James Patterson and Nancy Allen
books.desc: A young lawyer winds up in an Alabama jail that remains mysteriously crowded.

books.title: Dark Night of the Mountain Man
books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.desc: A gang of bank robbers, a medicine man and a giant grizzly bear complicate matters for Smoke Jensen.

books.title: Treasure State
books.author: C.J. Box
books.desc: The sixth book in the Cassie Dewell series. Cassie works two cases involving buried treasure and a con man.

books.title: Just After Sunset
books.author: Stephen King
books.desc: A collection of short stories that blend fantasy and psychological realism.

books.title: The Frontier Overland Company
books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.desc: Two men who met in a Wyoming saloon brawl start a stagecoach line in 1866.

books.title: Forever Under the Mistletoe
books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.desc: Two holiday stories: “When Christmas Comes” and “Christmas Letters.”

books.title: Clive Cussler: The Sea Wolves
books.author: Jack Du Brul
books.desc: The 13th book in the Isaac Bell adventure series. Bell searches for a technology that helps the Germans rule the seas in the summer of 1914.

books.title: The Boys from Biloxi
books.author: John Grisham
books.desc: Two childhood friends follow in their fathers’ footsteps, which puts them on opposite sides of the law.

books.title: Only the Dead
books.author: Jack Carr
books.desc: The sixth book in the Terminal List series. The killing of a freshman congressman reverberates for decades and James Reece faces a global conspiracy.

books.title: Overkill
books.author: Sandra Brown
books.desc: A former football star falls for a state prosecutor at the same time he must decide whether to kill his ex-wife, who is on life support, to ensnare her attacker.

books.title: Iron Flame
books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.desc: She's survived her first year at Basgiath War College for dragon riders...but the danger is just beginning in the electrifying follow-up to Fourth Wing.

books.title: The Heaven & Earth Grocery Store
books.author: James McBride
books.desc: Bringing his masterly storytelling skills and his deep faith in humanity to The Heaven & Earth Grocery Store, James McBride has written a novel as compassionate as Deacon King Kong and as inventive as The Good Lord Bird. An August 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Fourth Wing
books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.desc: Enter the brutal and elite world of a war college for dragon riders from bestselling author Rebecca Yarros.

books.title: Tom Lake
books.author: Ann Patchett
books.desc: In this beautiful and moving novel about family, love, and growing up, Ann Patchett once again proves herself one of America's finest writers. An August 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Demon Copperhead
books.author: Barbara Kingsolver
books.desc: Kingsolver's brilliant novel enthralls, compels, and captures the heart as it evokes a young hero's unforgettable journey to maturity. A November 2022 Indie Next Pick and a winner of the 2023 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.

books.title: Lessons in Chemistry
books.author: Bonnie Garmus
books.desc: Funny, shrewdly observant, and studded with a dazzling cast of supporting characters, Lessons in Chemistry is as original and vibrant as its protagonist. An April 2022 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
books.author: Gabrielle Zevin
books.desc: The exhilarating new novel by the bestselling author of The Storied Life of A. J. Fikry is the #1 Indie Next Pick for July 2022.

books.title: North Woods
books.author: Daniel Mason
books.desc: When two young lovers abscond from a Puritan colony, little do they know that their humble cabin in the woods will become the home of an extraordinary succession of human and nonhuman characters alike. An October 2023 Indie Next List Pick.

books.title: The Covenant of Water
books.author: Abraham Verghese
books.desc: Verghese's new novel is a stunning and magisterial epic of love, faith, and medicine, set in Kerala, South India, following three generations of a family seeking the answers to a strange secret. A May 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Prophet Song
books.author: Paul Lynch
books.desc:
Paul Lynch's novel presents a terrifying and shocking vision of a country sliding into authoritarianism and a deeply human portrait of a mother's fight to hold her family together.
Winner of the Booker Prize 2023.

books.title: Fourth Wing Special Edition
books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.desc: The year's biggest book sensation returns in this completely jaw-dropping special edition.

books.title: So Late in the Day: Stories of Women and Men
books.author: Claire Keegan
books.desc: From Booker Prize Finalist and bestselling author of Small Things Like These, comes a triptych of stories about love, lust, betrayal, and the ever-intriguing interchanges between women and men. A November 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Remarkably Bright Creatures
books.author: Shelby Van Pelt
books.desc: A charming, witty and compulsively readable exploration of friendship, reckoning, and hope that traces a widow's unlikely connection with a giant Pacific octopus. A May 2022 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: The Little Liar
books.author: Mitch Albom
books.desc: Mitch Albom returns with a powerful novel that moves from a coastal Greek city during the Holocaust, to America, where the intertwined lives of three survivors are forever changed by the perils of deception and the grace of redemption.

books.title: The Fraud
books.author: Zadie Smith
books.desc: From acclaimed and bestselling novelist Zadie Smith, a kaleidoscopic work of historical fiction set against the legal trial that divided Victorian England, about who gets to tell their storyand who gets to be believed. A September 2023 Indie Next List Pick.

books.title: Oath and Honor: A Memoir and a Warning
books.author: Liz Cheney
books.desc: A gripping first-hand account of the January 6th, 2021, insurrection from inside the halls of Congress, from origins to aftermath--by the House Republican leader who dared to stand up to it.

books.title: The Creative Act: A Way of Being
books.author: Rick Rubin
books.desc: From the legendary music producer, a master at helping people connect with the wellsprings of their creativity, comes a beautifully crafted book many years in the making that offers that same deep wisdom to all of us.

books.title: The Wager: A Tale of Shipwreck, Mutiny and Murder
books.author: David Grann
books.desc: The Wager is a grand tale of human behavior at the extremes told by David Grann, one of our greatest nonfiction writers. A May 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: How to Know a Person: The Art of Seeing Others Deeply and Being Deeply Seen
books.author: David Brooks
books.desc: A practical, heartfelt guide to the art of truly knowing another person in order to foster deeper connections at home, at work, and throughout our lives.

books.title: The Woman in Me
books.author: Britney Spears
books.desc: Written with remarkable candor and humor, Spears's groundbreaking book illuminates the enduring power of music and love--and the importance of a woman telling her own story, on her own terms, at last.

books.title: Democracy Awakening: Notes on the State of America
books.author: Heather Cox Richardson
books.desc: Many books tell us what has happened over the last five years. Democracy Awakening explains how we got to this perilous point, what our history really tells us about ourselves, and what the future of democracy can be.

books.title: Prequel: An American Fight Against Fascism
books.author: Rachel Maddow
books.desc: Rachel Maddow traces the fight to preserve American democracy back to World War II, when a handful of committed public servants and brave private citizens thwarted far-right plotters trying to steer our nation toward an alliance with the Nazis.

books.title: Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
books.author: James Clear
books.desc: James Clear reveals practical strategies that will teach you exactly how to form good habits, break bad ones, and master the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

books.title: Friends, Lovers, and the Big Terrible Thing: A Memoir
books.author: Matthew Perry
books.desc: Matthew Perry's memoir is is both intimate and eye-opening--as well as a hand extended to anyone struggling with sobriety. Unflinchingly honest, moving, and uproariously funny, this is the book fans have been waiting for.

books.title: Hidden Potential: The Science of Achieving Greater Things
books.author: Adam Grant
books.desc: This book reveals how anyone can rise to achieve greater things. The true measure of your potential is not the height of the peak you've reached, but how far you've climbed to get there.

books.title: The Comfort of Crows: A Backyard Year
books.author: Margaret Renkl
books.desc: From the bestselling author of Late Migrations comes a luminous book that traces the passing of seasons, personal and natural. A November 2023 Indie Next Pick.

books.title: Going Infinite: The Rise and Fall of a New Tycoon
books.author: Michael Lewis
books.desc: From the bestselling author of The Big Short and Flash Boys, the story of FTX's spectacular collapse and the enigmatic founder at its center.

books.title: Elon Musk
books.author: Walter Isaacson
books.desc: An astonishingly intimate biography of the most fascinating and controversial innovator of our eraa rule-breaking visionary who helped to lead the world into the era of electric vehicles, private space exploration, and artificial intelligence.

books.title: The Boy, the Mole, the Fox and the Horse
books.author: Charlie Mackesy
books.desc: Radiant with Mackesy's warmth and gentle wit, The Boy, the Mole, the Fox, and the Horse blends hand-written narrative with dozens of drawings.

books.title: My Name Is Barbra
books.author: Barbra Streisand
books.desc: No entertainer's memoir has been more anticipated than Barbra Streisand's, and this engrossing and delightful book will be eagerly welcomed by her millions of fans.

books.title: A Court of Thorns and Roses
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.desc: From bestselling author Sarah J. Maas comes a seductive, breathtaking book that blends romance, adventure, and faerie lore into an unforgettable read.

books.title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.desc: Reid's novel is a mesmerizing journey through the splendor of old Hollywood into the harsh realities of the present day.

books.title: Trust
books.author: Hernan Diaz
books.desc: Trust is an unparalleled novel about money, power, intimacy, and perception. A May 2022 Indie Next Pick and a winner of the 2023 Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.

books.title: All the Light We Cannot See
books.author: Anthony Doerr
books.desc: Doerr's beautiful novel about a blind French girl and a German boy whose paths collide in occupied France during World War II.

books.title: The Midnight Library
books.author: Matt Haig
books.desc: Haig's book is a dazzling novel about all the choices that go into a life well lived.

books.title: A Court of Mist and Fury
books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.desc: The seductive and stunning sequel to Sarah J. Maas's spellbinding A Court of Thorns and Roses.

books.title: The Thursday Murder Club
books.author: Richard Osman
books.desc: In a peaceful retirement village, four unlikely friends meet weekly to discuss unsolved crimes; together they call themselves the Thursday Murder Club.

books.title: The House in the Pines
books.author: Ana Reyes
books.desc: Armed with only hazy memories, a woman who long ago witnessed her friend's sudden, mysterious death, and has since spent her life trying to forget, sets out to track down answers.

books.title: Bookshops & Bonedust
books.author: Travis Baldree
books.desc: Set in the world of Legends & Lattes, Travis Baldree's Bookshops & Bonedust takes us on a journey of high fantasy, first loves, and secondhand books.

books.title: The Silent Patient
books.author: Alex Michaelides
books.desc: A gripping psychological thriller about a woman's act of violence against her husband--and of the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

books.title: A Little Life
books.author: Hanya Yanagihara
books.desc: Yanagihara's astonishing novel about love and friendship in the 21st century was a March 2015 Indie Next Pick and a National Book Award finalist.

books.title: Babel
books.author: R. F. Kuang
books.desc: Kuang's breathtaking novel grapples with student revolutions, colonial resistance, and the use of language and translation as the dominating tool of the British empire.

books.title: Never Whistle at Night: An Indigenous Dark Fiction Anthology
books.author: Shane Hawk (Ed.), Theodore C. Van Alst Jr. (Ed.)
books.desc: These wholly original and shiver-inducing tales introduce readers to ghosts, curses, hauntings, monstrous creatures, complex family legacies, desperate deeds, and chilling acts of revenge.

books.title: Icebreaker
books.author: Hannah Grace
books.desc: Sparks fly when a competitive figure skater and hockey team captain are forced to share a rink.

books.title: The Song of Achilles
books.author: Madeline Miller
books.desc: Miller's monumental debut novel is an action-packed adventure and epic love story that brilliantly re-imagines Homer's enduring masterwork, The Iliad.

books.title: Killers of the Flower Moon: The Osage Murders and the Birth of the FBI
books.author: David Grann
books.desc: Grann's twisting and haunting true-life murder mystery about one of the most monstrous crimes in American history.

books.title: The Boys in the Boat: Nine Americans and Their Epic Quest for Gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics
books.author: Daniel James Brown
books.desc: Brown tells the dramatic story of the American rowing team that stunned the world at the 1936 Berlin Olympics. Now a major motion picture.

books.title: Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants
books.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.desc: Drawing on her life as an Indigenous scientist, and as a woman, Kimmerer shows how other living beings offer us gifts and lessons, even if we've forgotten how to hear their voices.

books.title: The Hundred Years' War on Palestine: A History of Settler Colonialism and Resistance, 1917--2017
books.author: Rashid Khalidi
books.desc: A history of one hundred years of war waged against the Palestinians from the foremost US historian of the Middle East, told through pivotal events and family history.

books.title: All About Love: New Visions
books.author: bell hooks
books.desc: All About Love is a revelation about what causes a polarized society and how to heal the divisions that cause suffering.

books.title: Crying in H Mart: A Memoir
books.author: Michelle Zauner
books.desc: From the indie rock star of Japanese Breakfast, an unflinching, powerful memoir about growing up Korean American, losing her mother, and forging her own identity.

books.title: The Body Keeps the Score: Brain, Mind, and Body in the Healing of Trauma
books.author: Bessel van der Kolk, M.D.
books.desc: van der Kolk transforms our understanding of trauma and offers a bold new paradigm for healing.

books.title: The Storyteller: Tales of Life and Music
books.author: Dave Grohl
books.desc: A candid and insightful memoir by the popular member of Nirvana and the Foo Fighters.

books.title: Think Again: The Power of Knowing What You Don't Know
books.author: Adam Grant
books.desc: Grant examines the critical art of rethinking: learning to question your opinions and open other people's minds, which can position you for excellence at work and wisdom in life.

books.title: An Immense World: How Animal Senses Reveal the Hidden Realms Around Us
books.author: Ed Yong
books.desc: Every kind of animal, including humans, is enclosed within its own unique sensory bubble, perceiving but a tiny sliver of our immense world. In An Immense World, science journalist Ed Yong helps us to experience the skeins of scent, waves of electromagnetism, and pulses of pressure that other animals perceive.

books.title: Everything I Know About Love: A Memoir
books.author: Dolly Alderton
books.desc: A wildly funny, occasionally heartbreaking memoir about growing up, growing older, and learning to navigate friendships, jobs, loss, and love along the ride. Now streaming on Peacock.

books.title: The Song of the Cell: An Exploration of Medicine and the New Human
books.author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
books.desc: Rich with Mukherjee's revelatory and exhilarating stories of scientists, doctors, and the patients whose lives may be saved by their work, The Song of the Cell is the third book in this extraordinary writer's exploration of what it means to be human.

books.title: American Prometheus: The Triumph and Tragedy of J. Robert Oppenheimer
books.author: Kai Bird, Martin J. Sherwin
books.desc: A deep, fantastic look at the complex physicist and father of the atomic bomb.

books.title: The Lyrics: 1956 to the Present
books.author: Paul McCartney
books.desc: A work of unparalleled candor and splendorous beauty, The Lyrics celebrates the creative life and the musical genius of Paul McCartney through 154 of his most meaningful songs.

books.title: The 2024 Old Farmer's Almanac
books.author: Old Farmer's Almanac
books.desc: The annual almanac of weather, astrology, calendars, gardening tips, home remedies, and more all presented in the inimitably useful and humorous way it has done since 1792.

books.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
books.author: Anne Frank

books.title: Taylor Swift: A Little Golden Book Biography
books.author: Wendy Loggia, Elisa Chavarri (Illus.)

books.title: How the Grinch Stole Christmas!
books.author: Dr. Seuss
books.publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers

books.title: Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Sleigh!
books.author: Mo Willems

books.title: Lila Greer, Teacher of the Year
books.author: Andrea Beaty, David Roberts (Illus.)

books.title: Dr. Seuss's How the Grinch Lost Christmas!
books.author: Alastair Heim, Aristides Ruiz (Illus.)
books.publisher: Random House Books for Young Readers

books.title: How Does Santa Go Down the Chimney?
books.author: Mac Barnett, Jon Klassen (Illus.)

books.title: Bluey 5-Minute Stories: 6 Stories in 1 Book? Hooray!
books.author: Penguin Young Readers Licenses

books.title: If I Was a Horse
